title: Known Limitations
description: Every data product has constraints — understanding them protects study validity

children.title: Coverage & Response
children.description: Not all FQHCs participate; response patterns may introduce bias
children.details: Center-level non-response can affect geographic and urban/rural representativeness

children.title: Center non-response
children.description: Some FQHCs decline or withdraw mid-year
children.details: High-impact: non-response can bias regional estimates if concentrated in specific geographies

children.title: Sampling variation
children.details: Moderate: standard errors are published and must be accounted for in analysis

children.title: Urban concentration
children.description: Participating centers skew toward urban areas
children.details: Moderate: rural FQHCs under-represented in early years

children.title: Voluntary participation
children.description: Centers opt in — not a probability sample of all FQHCs
children.details: Well-documented: weights adjust but cannot fully correct for non-random selection

children.title: Variable Restrictions
children.description: Some variables are suppressed or categorized in public files
children.details: State, MSA, and rare diagnosis codes require restricted file access

children.title: Geography capped at region
children.description: State and MSA identifiers are restricted-only
children.details: High-impact for geographic disparity studies — RDC access required

children.title: Rare dx suppressed
children.description: Small cell sizes lead to suppression in PUF
children.details: High-impact for rare condition research — restricted file needed

children.title: Continuous vars binned
children.description: Age and income grouped into categories in PUF
children.details: Moderate: granularity is lost; exact values available in restricted files

children.title: EHR field completeness
children.description: Not all EHR fields are populated across centers
children.details: Manageable: missingness rates are published per variable

children.title: Linkage Constraints
children.description: Record linkage introduces uncertainty and population-specific match rates
children.details: Younger patients and women of childbearing age have lower match rates

children.title: Match rate variation
children.description: 62–84% match depending on age and sex
children.details: High-impact: unlinked records may differ systematically from linked records

children.title: Probabilistic uncertainty
children.description: False positives and false negatives in matching
children.details: Moderate: match weight variables support sensitivity analysis

children.title: Reference year dependency
children.description: Linkage availability lags 2–3 years after encounter

children.title: SSN completeness
children.details: Manageable: deterministic + probabilistic hybrid mitigates this

children.title: Temporal Scope
children.description: Data begins in 2021 with no continuity to pre-redesign years
children.details: Pre-2021 NAMCS HC used different methods — pooling across the break is not valid

children.title: No pre-2021 continuity
children.description: Cannot trend with pre-2021 NAMCS HC data
children.details: High-impact for long-term trend studies — methodological break in 2021

children.title: Dashboard prelim status
children.description: Biannual estimates may be revised in final files
children.details: Moderate: clearly labeled; final microdata supersedes preliminary

children.title: 18–24 month publication lag
children.description: Final microdata files released well after collection year
children.details: Manageable: dashboard provides faster preliminary estimates
